result.execSummary:
The defendant Divontae L Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees due prior to the end of probation of case ending. 15CM002852.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*Restitution set at ZERO.
*Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 107 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Defendant must show proof of employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Divontae L Young

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 107 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Defendant must show proof of employment.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees due prior to the end of probation of case ending. 15CM002852.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Restitution set at ZERO.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Divontae L Young in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Divontae L Young in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Divontae L Young not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders case adjourned for Projected Guilty Plea on 12-23-15 at 1:30 , Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Divontae L Young not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Divontae L Young not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court set cash bond in the amount of $250.00 cash with TOT to Justice point for continued monitoring , due to violations.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Divontae L Young in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with WALGREENS.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
DEFENDANT WAS IN CUSTODY IN THE WAUKESHA COUNTY JAIL.

Defendant Divontae L Young in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Divontae L Young in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice point discharge report received and filed. lr
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

Defendant Divontae L Young not in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr
Violation report received and filed. lr
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Divontae L Young in court PRO SE.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant requests time to hire counsel. Court granted defendant's request. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel in branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with WALGREENS.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Divontae L Young in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Divontae L Young in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge SIEFERT.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
